Package com.dua3.meja.model.poi

Class PoiCell

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.meja.model.AbstractCell<PoiSheet,PoiRow,PoiCell>
com.dua3.meja.model.poi.PoiCell
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cell
public final class PoiCell extends AbstractCell<PoiSheet,PoiRow,PoiCell>
Concrete subclass of AbstractCell for Apache POI based workbooks.

    • getAsText

      public com.dua3.utility.text.RichText getAsText(Locale locale)
      Description copied from interface: Cell
      Return the textual representation of the cell's value as RichText, without applying the cell style.

      This method converts the underlying value to text using the given locale, but does not apply the cell's visual style (font, fill colors, etc.). Use Cell.getAsFormattedText(Locale) when you need the value as it would appear to the user, including cell styling.

      Examples (assuming a cell with numeric value 1234.5 and a German locale):

      • cell.getAsText(Locale.GERMANY) → RichText("1234.5") (no thousand separator, no style)
      • cell.getAsFormattedText(Locale.GERMANY) → RichText("1.234,5") (formatted, styled)
      • cell.toString(Locale.GERMANY) → "1.234,5" (plain String, formatted)
      Parameters:
      locale - the locale to use during formatting
      Returns:
      the cell value as a RichText instance without applying cell style
      See Also:
      • Cell.getAsFormattedText(Locale)
      • Cell.toString(Locale)

      protected PoiWorkbook getAbstractWorkbook()

      Specified by:

    • getHorizontalSpan

      public int getHorizontalSpan()
      Description copied from interface: Cell
      Get the horizontal span.

      The horizontal span of a merged cells is the horizontal number of merged cells for the top left cell of the merged cells and 0 for the other merged cells. For cells that are not merged, the span is 1.

      Returns:
      horizontal span for this cell

    • getNumber

      Description copied from interface: Cell

      numeric cell value

    • getResultType

      public CellType getResultType()
      Description copied from interface: Cell
      Return the result type.

      For non-formula cells, this is the same as the value returned by Cell.getCellType(). For formula cells, the result type of the last evaluation is returned.

      Note: Since excel doesn't know about dates internally and date cells are determined by looking at both cell type and format, the cell style has to be set before calling this method to make sure CellType.DATE is returned for formulas that return a date.

      Returns:
      cell type

    • getRowNumber

      Description copied from interface: Cell

    • getVerticalSpan

      public int getVerticalSpan()
      Description copied from interface: Cell
      Get the vertical span.

      The vertical span of a merged cells is the vertical number of merged cells for the top left cell of the merged cells and 0 for the other merged cells. For cells that are not merged, the span is 1.

      Returns:
      vertical span for this cell

    • toString

      public String toString(Locale locale)
      Description copied from interface: Cell
      Return the localized string representation of the cell's value.

      This method returns a plain String suitable for display or export (e.g., CSV). It formats the value using the provided locale and the cell's data format, but does not carry styling information. For a styled representation, use Cell.getAsFormattedText(Locale). For a non-styled RichText, use Cell.getAsText(Locale).

      Examples:

      • Number 1234.5 with German locale: cell.toString(Locale.GERMANY) → "1.234,5"
      • Date 2025-01-02 with US locale (short date style): cell.toString(Locale.US) → "1/2/25"
      Parameters:
      locale - locale for formatting
      Returns:
      string representation of the cell content for the given locale
      See Also:
      • Cell.getAsText(Locale)
      • Cell.getAsFormattedText(Locale)
